alert.note: Alert for Gila; Maricopa (Arizona) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Phoenix (Central Arizona and California Desert)
info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued July 30 at 5:19PM MST until July 30 at 9:30PM MST by NWS Phoenix
info.description: The National Weather Service in Phoenix has issued a * Flash Flood Warning for... The Woodbury-Campaign Creek burn scar in... Gila County in east central Arizona... Maricopa County in south central Arizona... * Until 930 PM MST. * At 519 PM MST, Doppler radar indicated thunderstorms producing heavy rain over the Woodbury-Campaign Creek Burn Scar. Up to 1.5 inches of rain have fallen. Additional rainfall amounts of 0.5 to 1.5 inches are possible in the warned area. Flash flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly. HAZARD...Life threatening flash flooding. Thunderstorms producing flash flooding in and around the Woodbury- Campaign Creek Burn Scar. SOURCE...Radar. IMPACT...Life threatening flash flooding of areas in and around the Woodbury-Campaign Creek Burn Scar. * Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... Roosevelt, Tonto National Monument, Roosevelt Dam, Apache Lake and Roosevelt Estates. This includes the following highways... AZ Route 188 between mile markers 230 and 239. FLASH FLOOD...RADAR INDICATED FLASH FLOOD DAMAGE THREAT...CONSIDERABLE
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be aware of your surroundings and do not drive on flooded roads. Stay away or be swept away. River banks and culverts can become unstable and unsafe.
